actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Banking.
Committee on Banking requested executive comment from Federal Reserve System; Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation; Federal Home Loan Bank Board.
Committee on Banking requested executive comment from Comptroller of the Currency; National Credit Union Administration.
Committee on Banking received executive comment from Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. Favorable.
Committee on Banking received executive comment from National Credit Union Administration. Favorable.
Committee on Banking received executive comment from Federal Home Loan Bank Board. Favorable.
Committee on Banking received executive comment from Comptroller of the Currency. Favorable.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to amend section 205 of the Federal Credit Union Act.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Credit Union Act to permit the National Credit Union Administration Board to authorize a merger or consolidation of an insured credit union which is insolvent or is in danger of insolvency with any other insured credit union. Permits the Board to authorize a purchase and assumption by an insured credit union of all or any part of the assets and liabilities of any other insured credit union which is insolvent or in danger of insolvency if the Board is satisfied that any emergency requiring expeditious action exists with respect to such credit union and that other alternatives are not reasonably available.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 205 of the Federal Credit Union Act.
